body.body: A total of 2 micrograms of genomic DNA is used as input into the GAPF assay.
Split sample evenly into two 0.2 ml thin-walled PCR tubes.

Using manufacturer's supplied buffers, digest 1 µg of genomic DNA with KpnI \(10 U) in final volume of 20 µl. In the other tube, digest 1 µg with SbfI \(10 U) in a final volume of 20 µl. Incubate at 37˚C for 6 hours.

Heat inactivate restriction enzymes by incubating samples at 65˚C for 20 minutes.
  


_May freeze sample \(-20˚C) at this point_
From above step, combine restriction digestions into one tube \(final volume = 40 µl).
Add 3 µl of 3M NaCl, 45 µl formamide, and 2 µl water to tube. _May make master mix if performing multiple reactions._
Place in thermocycler preheated to 100˚C. Incubate for 7 minutes to denature DNA.
Remove tube from thermocycler and immediately place in ice-water bath. Incubate for 7 minutes.
To sample from previous step, add 8 µl 3M NaCl, 12 µl 10x S1 nuclease buffer, 8 µl water and 1 µl S1 nuclease \(200 U/µl). _May make master mix if performing multiple reactions._

title: **Note:**
body: Dilute stock of S1 nuclease \(~1000 U/µl) in Dilution buffer to obtain 200 U/µl.

body.body: Incubate at 37˚C for 60 minutes.

For most consistent results, use ChargeSwitch PCR Clean-Up Kit \(Invitrogen) to purify DNA. _Alternatively, one may purify DNA using phenol:chloroform extraction followed by ethanol precipitation \(use glycogen as carrier). Resuspend DNA pellet in 84 µl 1/10 TE._
Transfer S1 digested DNA to 1.7 ml microfuge tube.
Add 120 μl Purification Buffer \(N5) and mix.
Add 10 μl Magnetic Beads and mix by pipetting up and down gently.
Incubate 1 minute.
Place sample on MagnaRack for 1 minute to pellet beads.
Without removing tube from MagnaRack, remove and discard supernatant.
Remove tube from MagnaRack.
Add 150 μl of Wash Buffer.
Pipet up and down gently to mix.
Place sample on MagnaRack for 1 minute to pellet beads.
Without removing tube from MagnaRack, remove and discard supernatant.
Remove tube from MagnaRack.
Add 150 μl of Wash Buffer.
Pipet up and down gently to mix.
Place sample on MagnaRack for 1 minute to pellet beads.
Without removing tube from MagnaRack, remove and discard supernatant.
Remove tube from MagnaRack.
Add 84 μl of Elution Buffer \(E5).
Pipet up and down gently to mix.
Incubate 1 minute.
Place sample on MagnaRack for 1 minute to pellet beads.

Without removing tube from MagnaRack, remove and save sample. Discard beads. A total of 80 µl will be used for next step in protocol. The leftover 4 µl can be used for PCR-based enrichment assays for quality control or troubleshooting. 
  


_May freeze sample \(-20˚C) at this point_

Using manufacturer's supplied buffers, digest 40 µl of purified DNA from previous step with MseI \(10 U) in final volume of 50 µl, and digest the other 40 µl of purified DNA with MspI \(40 U) in final volume of 50 µl.
Incubate for 37˚C for 2 hours.

Heat inactivate MseI digest by incubating at 65˚C for 20 minutes; MspI digest requires incubation at 80˚C for 20 minutes for inactivation.
  


_May freeze sample \(-20˚C) at this point_





_Linker ligation_
Add the following to the 50 µl restriction digest from previous step: 5 µl of appropriate linker \(MseI or MspI linker), 7 µl 10x T4 DNA Ligase buffer, 7 µl water, and 1 µl T4 DNA ligase \(400 U/µl).
Incubate at 16˚C for 3 hours.

Heat inactivate ligase by incubating at 70˚C for 20 minutes.
  


_Remove unligated linkers_
To Amicon Ultracel-50 \(50 kDa cutoff) Membrane 0.5 mL column, add 160 µl 1/10 TE and entire ligation mix \(70 µl of either MseI or MspI ligation) from previous step.
Spin 14,000 x g for 5-10 minutes until volume concentrated to ~20 µl.

Recover DNA by placing inverted column into new tube and spinning at 1,000 x g for 2 minutes.
  


_PCR amplification_


Set up the following PCR reaction:


4 µl template DNA \(from above)


10 µl 10x PCR Buffer


10 µl 2 mM dNTPs


12 µl Linker specific primer \(10 pmol/μl; use either JW-102gMse or JW-102gMsp)


0.8 µl FastStart Taq \(Roche)


20 µl 5x GC-rich solution


43.2 µl water





_Cycling conditions_


96˚C 6 minutes


Then


30 cycles of:


96˚C     30 seconds


55˚C     30 seconds


72˚C     30 seconds


Then


72˚C     7 minutes


4˚C     Hold


  


Run 1 μl of 100 μl PCR sample on agarose gel for quality control \(Average size range of Mse PCR <sub>300-800 bp; Msp PCR </sub>200-600 bp).





_PCR clean-up_
To Amicon Ultracel-30 \(30 kDa cutoff) Membrane 0.5 mL column, add 300 µl 1/10 TE and combined MseI and MspI PCR samples \(~198 µl) from previous step.
Spin 14,000 x g for 20-30 minutes until volume concentrated to ~20 µl.
Recover DNA by placing inverted column into new tube and spinning at 1,000 x g for 2 minutes.

Quantitate DNA by Nanodrop. Should get a little greater than 7.5 µg in total.
  


_May freeze sample \(-20˚C) at this point_





_

title: **The following protocol is for labeling DNA for the Affymetrix Tiling Array platform. If a different platform is desired, please modify protocol from this point forward as needed.**
**DNA fragmentation**
body:
Perform in 0.2 mL PCR tube in a thermocycler:





42.2 µl  DNA \(7.5 μg from above in water to 42.2 µl final volume)


4.8 µl  10x DNase I buffer


1 µl  Diluted DNase I \(0.0167 U; NEB) _\(Dilute 2 U/μl stock => 1 μl stock + 107 μl water + 12 μl 10x DNase I buffer)_


 


37°C for 35 minutes


95°C for 15 minutes


4˚C hold





_3 µl of DNA may be used on Bioanalyzer \(Agilent) to measure DNA fragmentation profile for quality control purposes. Results of the Bioanalyzer analysis of fragmented DNA should show that the majority of fragmented DNA is between 25 to 200 bases, with the peak of the distribution between 25 to 100 bases._

title: **DNA labeling**
body:
Perform in 0.2 mL PCR tube in a thermocycler; Affy GeneChip WT Double-stranded Target Labeling Kit)





45 µl  Fragmented DNA \(from above)


12 µl  5x TdT buffer


2 µl  TdT


1 µl  DNA labeling reagent 


 


37°C for 1 hour


70°C for 10 minutes


4˚C hold





Sample now ready for hybridization to Tiling array and processing per Affymetrix protocol
